item.title: Herblore
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

You’re welcome for me telling you to use an Enum and helping you, Lorenzo. I’ve written my classes now, the only ones working are Saradomin Brews at the moment.

@imsuperman05, there’s nothing wrong with using an Enum if It’s done correctly. Potions are the perfect place to do this.

Read full topic

item.title: Herblore
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

[quote=“TheHolyGrail, post:32, topic:427991”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=530684.msg3876473#msg3876473 date=1325711906]
Works flawless though and I like it more than arrays

NOT FINISHED YET!
[/quote]That’s because you haven’t gotten to where potions use the same items.[/quote]

Works fine man.

	public static void makePot(Player player, int itemUsed, int useWith) {
		Herb herb = pots.get(itemUsed > useWith ? itemUsed | useWith >> 2 : useWith | itemUsed >> 2);
		if (herb != null) {
			/* handle herblore pot making, cbf posting everything */
		}
	}

	private static enum Herb {
		/* decided to remove most pots */
		SUPER_RESTORE( 3004, 223, 3024, 63, 71);

		private int item1;
		private int item2;
		private int itemReward;
		private int herbLvl;
		private int xpReward;

		public int hash() {
			return item1 | item2 >> 2;
		}

		private Herb(int item1, int item2, int itemReward, int herbLvl, int xpReward) {
			this.item1 = item1;
			this.item2 = item2;
			this.itemReward = itemReward;
			this.herbLvl = herbLvl;
			this.xpReward = xpReward;
		}
	}

	private static Map<Integer, Herb> pots = new HashMap<Integer, Herb>();

	static {
		for (Herb pot : Herb.values()) {
			pots.put(pot.hash(), pot);
		}
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Herblore
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:31, topic:427991”]Works flawless though and I like it more than arrays

package server.skills;

import server.client;
import java.util.HashMap;

public class PotEnum {
	
	public static int herbEmote = 363;
	public static long actionInterval = 1250;
    public static long lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
	 
	static enum Pots {
		POT1 ( 3046, 3046, 3044, "2"),
		POT2 ( 0, 0, 0, "0");
	
	int firstItem, secondItem, newItem;
	String dosesLeft;
	
	static HashMap<Integer, Pots> combinePots = new HashMap<Integer, Pots>();
	
		static {
			for (final Pots f : Pots.values()) {
				Pots.combinePots.put(f.firstItem, f);
				Pots.combinePots.put(f.secondItem, f);
			}
		}

		static Pots forId(final int id) {
			return Pots.combinePots.get(id);
		}

		Pots(int firstItem, int secondItem, int newItem, String dosesLeft) {
			this.firstItem = firstItem;
			this.secondItem = secondItem;
			this.newItem = newItem;
			this.dosesLeft = dosesLeft;
		}
	
        public static void potOnPot(client c, int Item, int Item2) {
			final Pots f = Pots.combinePots.get(Item);
					c.deleteItem(f.firstItem, 1);
					c.deleteItem(f.secondItem, 1);
					c.addItem(f.newItem, 1);
					c.setAnimation(herbEmote);
					c.sM(new StringBuilder() .append("You have combined the liquid into")
						.append(f.dosesLeft) .append(" doses").toString());
					}
            }

	public static void potOnPot(client c, int itemUsed, int useWith) {
		final Pots f = Pots.combinePots.get(itemUsed);
						Pots.combinePots.get(useWith);
		c.deleteItem(f.firstItem, 1);
		c.deleteItem(f.secondItem, 1);
		c.addItem(f.newItem, 1);
		c.setAnimation(herbEmote);
		c.sM(new StringBuilder() .append("You have combined the liquid into ")
			.append(f.dosesLeft) .append(" doses").toString());
		}

		
	}

NOT FINISHED YET![/quote]That’s because you haven’t gotten to where potions use the same items.

Read full topic

item.title: Herblore
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Works flawless though and I like it more than arrays

package server.skills;

import server.client;
import java.util.HashMap;

public class PotEnum {
	
	public static int herbEmote = 363;
	public static long actionInterval = 1250;
    public static long lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
	 
	static enum Pots {
		POT1 ( 3046, 3046, 3044, "2"),
		POT2 ( 0, 0, 0, "0");
	
	int firstItem, secondItem, newItem;
	String dosesLeft;
	
	static HashMap<Integer, Pots> combinePots = new HashMap<Integer, Pots>();
	
		static {
			for (final Pots f : Pots.values()) {
				Pots.combinePots.put(f.firstItem, f);
				Pots.combinePots.put(f.secondItem, f);
			}
		}

		static Pots forId(final int id) {
			return Pots.combinePots.get(id);
		}

		Pots(int firstItem, int secondItem, int newItem, String dosesLeft) {
			this.firstItem = firstItem;
			this.secondItem = secondItem;
			this.newItem = newItem;
			this.dosesLeft = dosesLeft;
		}
	
        public static void potOnPot(client c, int Item, int Item2) {
			final Pots f = Pots.combinePots.get(Item);
					c.deleteItem(f.firstItem, 1);
					c.deleteItem(f.secondItem, 1);
					c.addItem(f.newItem, 1);
					c.setAnimation(herbEmote);
					c.sM(new StringBuilder() .append("You have combined the liquid into")
						.append(f.dosesLeft) .append(" doses").toString());
					}
            }

	public static void potOnPot(client c, int itemUsed, int useWith) {
		final Pots f = Pots.combinePots.get(itemUsed);
						Pots.combinePots.get(useWith);
		c.deleteItem(f.firstItem, 1);
		c.deleteItem(f.secondItem, 1);
		c.addItem(f.newItem, 1);
		c.setAnimation(herbEmote);
		c.sM(new StringBuilder() .append("You have combined the liquid into ")
			.append(f.dosesLeft) .append(" doses").toString());
		}

		
	}

NOT FINISHED YET!

item.title: Herblore
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:26, topic:427991”][code=java]
package server.skills;

import server.PlayerHandler;
import server.client;

/**

  • @author RandQm
  • @Version 1.0
    */

public class Testpots {

public static int herbEmote = 363;
public static long actionInterval = 1250;
    public static long lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();

public static int[][] potCombinding = {
	/* pot used  */
	{3046, 3046, 3046, 3044, 179, 179, 179, 177, 3030, 3030, 3030, 3028, 6691, 6691, 6691, 6689, 143, 143, 143, 141, 173, 173, 173, 171, 119, 119, 119, 117, 161, 161, 
		161, 159, 167, 167, 167, 165, 137, 137, 137, 135, 125, 125, 125, 123, 149, 149, 149, 147},
	/* used with this pot */
	{3046, 3044, 3042, 3044, 179, 177, 175, 177, 3030, 3028, 3026, 3028, 6691, 6689, 6687, 6689, 143, 141, 139, 141, 173, 171, 169, 171, 119, 117, 115, 117, 161, 159, 
			157, 159, 167, 165, 163, 165, 137, 135, 133, 135, 125, 123, 121, 123, 149, 147, 145, 147},
	/* added pot */
	{3044, 3042, 3040, 3044, 177, 175, 2446, 2446, 3028, 3026, 3024, 3024, 6685, 6687, 6685, 6685, 141, 139, 2434, 2434, 171, 169, 2444, 2444, 117, 115, 113, 113, 159, 
				157, 2440, 2440, 165, 163, 2442, 2442, 135, 133, 2432, 2432, 123, 121, 2428, 2428, 147, 145, 2436, 2436},
};
public static String[] doseLeft = {"2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4",
	"2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", };


    /* replace pots */
    public static void combinePots(int playerId, int firstId, int secondId, int newId) {
        final client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
         c.deleteItem(firstId, 1);
         c.deleteItem(secondId, 1);
         c.addItem(newId, 1);
         c.addItem(229, 1);
 }
    public static void combineAction(final int playerId, final int ArrayIndex) {
        final client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
    
    if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction < actionInterval)
        return;
    
    int Pot1 = potCombinding[0][ArrayIndex];
    int Pot2 = potCombinding[1][ArrayIndex];
    int newPot = potCombinding[2][ArrayIndex];
    String doses = doseLeft[ArrayIndex];
    
        c.setAnimation(herbEmote);
        lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
        	combinePots(playerId, Pot1, Pot2, newPot);
        	c.sM("You have combined the liquid into "+doses+" doses.");
    }

}

[/code][/quote]
The way you’re using the array atm is dangerous.

@Team
Why would you use an enum for something simple… even though im against arrays sometimes, there’s no need for an enum in this.

Read full topic

 }

item.title: Herblore
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

package server.skills;

import server.PlayerHandler;
import server.client;

/**
 *  @author RandQm
 *  @Version 1.0
 */

public class Testpots {
	
	public static int herbEmote = 363;
	public static long actionInterval = 1250;
        public static long lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();

    public static int[][] potCombinding = {
		/* pot used  */
    	{3046, 3046, 3046, 3044, 179, 179, 179, 177, 3030, 3030, 3030, 3028, 6691, 6691, 6691, 6689, 143, 143, 143, 141, 173, 173, 173, 171, 119, 119, 119, 117, 161, 161, 
    		161, 159, 167, 167, 167, 165, 137, 137, 137, 135, 125, 125, 125, 123, 149, 149, 149, 147},
		/* used with this pot */
		{3046, 3044, 3042, 3044, 179, 177, 175, 177, 3030, 3028, 3026, 3028, 6691, 6689, 6687, 6689, 143, 141, 139, 141, 173, 171, 169, 171, 119, 117, 115, 117, 161, 159, 
    			157, 159, 167, 165, 163, 165, 137, 135, 133, 135, 125, 123, 121, 123, 149, 147, 145, 147},
		/* added pot */
		{3044, 3042, 3040, 3044, 177, 175, 2446, 2446, 3028, 3026, 3024, 3024, 6685, 6687, 6685, 6685, 141, 139, 2434, 2434, 171, 169, 2444, 2444, 117, 115, 113, 113, 159, 
    				157, 2440, 2440, 165, 163, 2442, 2442, 135, 133, 2432, 2432, 123, 121, 2428, 2428, 147, 145, 2436, 2436},
	};
    public static String[] doseLeft = {"2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4",
    	"2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", "2", "3", "4", "4", };
    
	
        /* replace pots */
        public static void combinePots(int playerId, int firstId, int secondId, int newId) {
            final client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
             c.deleteItem(firstId, 1);
             c.deleteItem(secondId, 1);
             c.addItem(newId, 1);
             c.addItem(229, 1);
     }
        public static void combineAction(final int playerId, final int ArrayIndex) {
            final client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];
        
        if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction < actionInterval)
            return;
        
        int Pot1 = potCombinding[0][ArrayIndex];
        int Pot2 = potCombinding[1][ArrayIndex];
        int newPot = potCombinding[2][ArrayIndex];
        String doses = doseLeft[ArrayIndex];
        
            c.setAnimation(herbEmote);
            lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
            	combinePots(playerId, Pot1, Pot2, newPot);
            	c.sM("You have combined the liquid into "+doses+" doses.");
        }
}

@the_wanderer wrote:

I’m saying your only option would be an array or a List (iirc, don’t have all of the collections api memorized :P) as you use the same items for multiple potions so you have to reference by indeces andcan’t just grab an index for one item.

item.title: Herblore
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:16, topic:427991”]Here’s mine, I guess it’s so simular since I learned it you ^^

package server.skills;

import server.client;

/**
 * @RandQm
 */

public class CombinePots {
	
	 public static void potCombinding(client c, int Item, int Item2) {
		 if(Item == 3046 && Item2 == 3046 || Item == 3046 && Item2 == 3046) {
	            c.combinePots(3046, 3046, 3044, "2");
				}
		 if(Item == 3046 && Item2 == 3044 || Item == 3044 && Item2 == 3046) {
	            c.combinePots(3046, 3044, 3042, "3");
				}
		 if(Item == 3046 && Item2 == 3042 || Item == 3042 && Item2 == 3046) {
	            c.combinePots(3046, 3042, 3040, "4");
				}
		 if(Item == 3044 && Item2 == 3044 || Item == 3044 && Item2 == 3044) {
	            c.combinePots(3044, 3044, 3040, "4");
				}
		 if(Item == 179 && Item2 == 179 || Item == 179 && Item2 == 179) {
	            c.combinePots(179, 179, 177, "2");
		 		}
	     if(Item == 179 && Item2 == 177 || Item == 177 && Item2 == 179) {
		        c.combinePots(179, 177, 175, "3");
				}
	     if(Item == 179 && Item2 == 175 || Item == 175 && Item2 == 179) {
	            c.combinePots(179, 175, 2446, "4");
				}
	     if(Item == 177 && Item2 == 177 || Item == 177 && Item2 == 177) {
	            c.combinePots(177, 177, 2446, "4");
				}
	     if(Item == 3030 && Item2 == 3030 || Item == 3030 && Item2 == 3030) {
	            c.combinePots(3030, 3030, 3028, "2");
				}
	     if(Item == 3030 && Item2 == 3028 || Item == 3028 && Item2 == 3030) {
	            c.combinePots(3030, 3028, 3026, "3");
				}
	     if(Item == 3030 && Item2 == 3026 || Item == 3026 && Item2 == 3030) {
	            c.combinePots(3030, 3026, 3024, "4");
				}
	     if(Item == 3028 && Item2 == 3028 || Item == 3028 && Item2 == 3028) {
	            c.combinePots(3028, 3028, 3024, "4");
				}
	     if(Item == 6691 && Item2 == 6691 || Item == 6691 && Item2 == 6691) {
	            c.combinePots(6691, 6691, 6685, "2");
				}
	     if(Item == 6691 && Item2 == 6689 || Item == 6689 && Item2 == 6691) {
	            c.combinePots(6691, 6689, 6687, "3");
				}
	     if(Item == 6691 && Item2 == 6687 || Item == 6687 && Item2 == 6691) {
	            c.combinePots(6691, 6687, 6685, "4");
				}
	     if(Item == 6689 && Item2 == 6689 || Item == 6689 && Item2 == 6689) {
	            c.combinePots(6689, 6689, 6685, "4");
				}

client class:

/** * Combining pots */ public void combinePots (int first, int second, int added, String Msg) { deleteItem(first, getItemSlot(first), 1); deleteItem(second, getItemSlot(second), 1); addItem(added, 1); addItem(229, 1); sM("You have combined the liquid into "+Msg+" doses."); } [/quote]

The first one could be done more efficiently, it looks like Delta there. You’re on the right track though, doing a good job as far as I can see. Keep it up!

Read full topic

package server.skills;

import server.client;

/**

public class CombinePots {

		 if(Item == 3046 && Item2 == 3046 || Item == 3046 && Item2 == 3046) {

client class:

/**
	 * Combining pots
	 */
	public void combinePots (int first, int second, int added, String Msg) {
			deleteItem(first, getItemSlot(first), 1);
			deleteItem(second, getItemSlot(second), 1);
			addItem(added, 1);
			addItem(229, 1);
			sM("You have combined the liquid into "+Msg+" doses.");
			}
